title: Residential sales or leases; planning
context: §171-46 Residential sales or leases; planning. Prior to the disposition of public land for residential lots, whether by sale in fee simple or by lease, in addition to the requirements of section 171-33, the board of land and natural resources shall: (1) Make a determination of the demand for houselots in the area of the intended disposition; (2) Make a thorough investigation of the costs of the residential development; (3) Wherever possible locate the residential development adjacent to an existing urban center; (4) Subdivide and improve the land, in conformity with county or city and county zoning and subdivision requirements, including the construction of necessary roads; and (5) Plan the development to meet the economic need and circumstance of the persons for whom the development is intended. [L 1962, c 32, pt of §2; am L 1964, c 47, §2; am L 1965, c 239, §23; Supp, §103A-44; HRS §171-46]
